title: Jesus, Where'er Thy People Meet
author: William Cowper (1731-1800)
presentation: v1 v2 v3 v4 v5 v6 v7

v1: Where'er they seek Thee, Thou art found,
And every place is hallowed ground.
v2: For Thou, within no walls confined,
Such ever bring Thee where they come,
And going, take Thee to their home.
v3: Dear Shepherd of Thy chosen few,
Here, to our waiting hearts, proclaim
The sweetness of Thy saving name.
v4: Here may we prove the pow'r of prayer
To strengthen faith and sweeten care;
To teach our faint desires to rise,
And bring all heav'n before our eyes.
v5: Lord, we are few, but Thou art near;
Nor short Thine arm, nor deaf Thine ear;
Oh, rend the heav'ns, come quickly down,
And make our waiting hearts Thine own.
v6: Command Thy blessing in this hour;
And as the Spirit full of pow'r
With life and vision fill this place,
That all Thy purpose we may trace.
v7: O Thou, our Head, our Life, our Guide,
May nought in life or death divide
The saints in Thy communion blessed,
That all Thy fulness be expressed.
